segments.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
segments.en: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.

segments.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhagavā mahatiyā parisāya parivuto dhammaṃ deseti.
segments.en: Now, at that time the Buddha was teaching Dhamma, surrounded by a large assembly.

segments.pli: “ayaṃ kho samaṇo gotamo mahatiyā parisāya parivuto dhammaṃ deseti.
segments.en: “The ascetic Gotama is teaching Dhamma, surrounded by a large assembly.

segments.pli: Yannūnāhaṃ yena samaṇo gotamo tenupasaṅkameyyaṃ vicakkhukammāyā”ti.
segments.en: Why don’t I go and pull the wool over their eyes?”

segments.pli: Atha kho māro pāpimā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ gāthāya ajjhabhāsi:
segments.en: Then Māra the Wicked went up to the Buddha and addressed him in verse:
“Why now do you roar like a lion?
You’re so self-assured in the assembly!
For there is someone who’ll wrestle with you,
so why do you imagine you’re the victor?”
The Realized One, attained to power,
has crossed over clinging to the world.”

segments.pli: Atha kho māro pāpimā “jānāti maṃ bhagavā, jānāti maṃ sugato”ti dukkhī dummano tatthevantaradhāyīti.
segments.en: Then Māra the Wicked, thinking, “The Buddha knows me! The Holy One knows me!” miserable and sad, vanished right there.

sections.title: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī…

suttaplex.blurb: Māra criticizes the Buddha for his lion’s roar, asserting that the Buddha is not in fact peerless.
